Articles.Content:
Now, there is an ulterior motive here, but...

I would like to see dual launch pads and runways.

Dual Launch Pads (Or even Triple?)

----------------------------------

When building in the Space hanger, when you launch, you can pick 1 or 2.

If you picked 1, then tried to launch ANOTHER shuttle on 1, you'll get the message of "clear debris?". If you pick 2, well, it'll put you over there.

Reasons this would be cool:

1. Scenery of seeing another one of your ships ready to go while you take off from another.

2. Another ship ready to go for your mission.

3. It would just be kinda neat.

Dual Runways would in turn have taxi lanes, and would make the area seem a bit more... "connected", as currently, buildings, launch pads, etc are all somewhat separated by grass.

The runways can run in different directions, or even parallel to one another.
It would indeed be nice to see something like the above in KSP.

I see what you did there...

However it would be a cool option to expand your spaceport later on.
id like it for when i do a dangerous mission my backup is ready to go at a split second,
Your thinly disguised attempt to have this implemented so that you can recreate the Armageddon mission complete with blaring Aerosmith soundtrack has not gone unnoticed.
Other than looking kind of pretty, it'd serve absolutely no purpose. You can't fly two rockets at once, and there's no delay when launching a second ship.

Your thinly disguised attempt to have this implemented so that you can recreate the Armageddon mission complete with blaring Aerosmith soundtrack has not gone unnoticed.

LOL! You beat me to it. Well done sir, well done!

If there are two rockets on each launch Pad.Can you control them both and do the same actions as the Primary one ? Also those how about those "mover" where they put the rockets on and KSC has train tracks that is for some Purpose.

However it would be a cool option to expand your spaceport later on.

This has been suggested before. I doubt we'll be able to do it, but I'd love to be able to spend some of my cash to upgrade my KSC buildings and perhaps some level of their functionality as well.

I'd even be happy just to see their internals(and/or external models) getting upgraded as we progress through the tech tree in career mode. Would be fantastical, I think and would really make my space program feel like it's progressing through time and technologies.

As for the original topic, I wouldn't mind having another launch pad at the space center. Though it seems a little needless for KSP since it takes zero time to prep a rocket for takeoff
